title.narrative: Democratic Republic of Congo - Project to Mobilize and Revitalize Public Administration Human Resources (HR-MRP)
République Démocratique du Congo - Projet de mobilisation et de revitalisation des ressources humaines de l’administration publique (PMR-RH)

description.narrative: Les bénéficiaires du projet sont la Fonction Publique, Comité de Pilotage de la Réforme des Entreprises Publiques (COPIREP) et la Faculté Polytechnique de l’Université de Kinshasa.
The beneficiaries of the project are the Public Service, Public Enterprises Reform Steering Committee (COPIREP) and the University of Kinshasa Polytechnic Faculty.

Le projet de mobilisation et de revitalisation des ressources humaines de l’administration publique (PMR-RH) découle d’une étude menée par la Banque qui a fait le constat selon lequel les faiblesses structurelles au sein de l’administration publique congolaise ne permettaient pas au pays de mettre en œuvre son programme de développement, ainsi que les projets financés par les PTF. Le projet contribue à lever l’une des principales contraintes au développement du pays, à savoir la qualité de ses ressources humaines. Il est structuré autour de trois composantes à savoir: (i) les réponses aux besoins urgents en ressources humaines qualifiées pour la mise en œuvre du programme prioritaire; (ii) l’appui à la revitalisation des sources de génération pérenne de ressources humaines de haut niveau pour l’administration publique; (iii) la gestion du projet.

The project to Mobilize and Revitalize Public Administration Human Resources (PHR-MRP) stems from a Bank study which revealed that structural weaknesses within the Congolese Public Administration prevented the country from implementing its development program and projects funded by the technical and financial partners (TPFs). The project help to remove one of the main constraints to the country’s development, i.e. the quality of its human resources. It's structured around three components: (i) addressing the urgent need for qualified human resources to implement the priority program; (ii) supporting the revitalization of sources of sustainable generation of high-level human resources for the public administration; and (iii) project management.

L’objectif global du projet est de contribuer à la mise en œuvre du programme prioritaire 2011 – 2015 du Gouvernement. L’objectif spécifique du projet est de mettre à la disposition de l’administration publique congolaise, de manière ponctuelle et continue, des ressources humaines qualifiées en gestion économique et en génie civil.

The project’s overall objective is to contribute to the implementation of the 2011 – 2015 Government Priority Program. The specific objective is to provide the Congolese public administration, on a timely and continuous basis, with qualified human resources in economic management and civil engineering.

title.narrative: Number of ministries that have assigned staff in accordance with the revised organizational frameworks and structures
Number of awareness-raising campaigns organized for young girls
Number of staff who received insitu training
Number of lecturers provided for the polytechnic faculty
Discounted debtservice rate to export earnings

target.value: The model is operational by end 2012

actual.value: A new monetary programming model is available and operational

title.narrative: Qualified engineers and technicians trained by the faculty are recruited

target.value: 10% of engineers recruited by the State and at least 50% in the private sector from 2012 to 2015

title.narrative: Availability of a revised mediumterm rolling program budget for the 36 ministries

target.value: The 36 ministries have a revised mediumterm rolling program budget

actual.value: The 36 ministries have a revised medium-term rolling program budget
The FSRC procedures manual is available

title.narrative: Availability of a data base on the diaspora

target.value: 1 database on the diaspora available by 2012

actual.value: The diaspora data base is available at the level of DCE

title.narrative: Duration of the Polytechnic engineering course reduced from 9-10 years in 2010 to 6 years between 2012-2015

target.value: The duration of the Polytechnic engineering course is 6 years maximum

actual.value: The duration of Polytechnic’s engineering course is henceforth 5 years, thanks mainly to the recruitment of professors supported by the project
The organization of the round table was contingent on the update and validation of the 2012-2016 strategic plan

title.narrative: Availability of a system for maintaining the equipment of the Polytechnic Faculty

target.value: A system for maintaining the equipment of the Polytechnic Faculty available latest by 2012

actual.value: The system for maintaining the equipment of the Polytechnic Faculty not set up

title.narrative: Revision of the 2010-2012 strategic plan and availability of the new 2012-2016 strategic plan
